Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: If it's the path that has no light, I can't walk through it. \n My body won't move an inch.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Heh? Really? \n Seems like it's the same for you, too.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I think there's another way for you.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: In the next room, the storage room, there is a computer sitting on the table. \n And take this. \n It seems to be a hint on how to turn on that thing in there.
You received pictures.

Dialogue.name: Emma

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I'm going to read these papers for a while, might find something else.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: From what I read, I might know rather a lot. \n However...

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I might have forgot all of it. \n Ha ha...

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What?! \n Are you being serious?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: If your memory is that bad, why don't you just write it down on your body?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Oh my god! \n That's a great idea you've got there!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( She has got to be kidding me. )

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: ... I think I got something.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: From what I understand, you have skipped one of the test.

Dialogue.name: Elias

Dialogue.name: Emma

Dialogue.name: Emma

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Good evening sir Elias, I'm waiting for you. \n Can you help me with this bookshelf?

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Remember that you must not touch any books with black color. \n And try to adjust the rest of the books.

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Oh, and don't forget to look into the mirror.

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Don't forget to look into the mirror, it's just right in the middle of the bookshelf.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( He's not responding anymore. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What was that feeling! \n I felt like being picked up when I open the door.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: At least I got outside...a city, huh? \n Hm...I'm outisde but I can't feel the wind.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Emma said she's going to wait on the upper floor. \n What does that even mean? \n I need to ask her about this.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: The mansion door turned into a picuture, just like my door.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: This means that I'm still stuck in the experiment. \n Hopefully, I'm not the one going crazy.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( These people with strange masks are looking at me )

Dialogue.name: Asher
Dialogue.text: I heard a scientist just showed up.

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: How?! \n We need to find that man.

Dialogue.name: Asher
Dialogue.text: I think he used a secret tunnel to come here.

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: He must be planning something weird to us! \n Let's go warn everyone!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( A scientist st this place right now? \n This might be my exit. )

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: I heard that the scientist came here to kill us.

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: They think we have no use to them.

Dialogue.name: Asher
Dialogue.text: I never heard of anyone who got pass this place.

Dialogue.name: Asher
Dialogue.text: This experiment is just smoke and mirrors, they just want to kill us.

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: The chief will save us! \n The chief is always right!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( The chief? This place just gives me goosebumps. )

Dialogue.name: Charlotte
Dialogue.text: A scientist is hiding among us, it's going to kill us!

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: We need to do something! \n We need to take care of that scientist!

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: Who knows what kind of tortures are waiting for us if we get caught.

Dialogue.name: Charlotte
Dialogue.text: The chief is searching for him, he'll tell us about it anytime soon. \n Right now he is preparing for our new rookie.

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: I saw the writings in that scientist's paper, it says they are making clones of us.

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: They are going to brainwash us and create their army of clones.

Dialogue.name: Charlotte
Dialogue.text: Is this true?! They are treating us like a lab rat!

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Good day, you are the newcomer, yes? \n What's your name?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I'm Elias, and who are you? \n Why is everyone wearing some weird masks?

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: So your name is Elias. \n Soon, you will know why they have those smiles on their face.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I am Noel, the leader of these people, and you are an individual that needs a guiding light.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Thus why I am offering you to come with us.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( This person is overly suspicious, only mad people would believe him. )

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I know you probably have no interest in what I am doing. \n But I do believe, that that is not a smart idea.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What do you mean?

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: In other words, I can assist you with finding the way out. \n Especially now, as I have got my hands on these fascinating data.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Does he know the way out? )

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I have my duty -- to assist people in getting out. \n But not everyone gets the privilege.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: And what will I have to do for you to let me out?

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: First of all, I have someone waiting inside. \n Talk to them. This will be... something like a test.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I'll answer your questions... after you've passed the test.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( This door is locked. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( This door is locked. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Should I enter?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( ...This whole house is just a picture projected on the wall. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: This is just a hologram.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Behind this? \n Isn't this a hologram?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Hm? \n My hand is going through the picture!

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: Hey! \n I heard you take care of the traitor for us.

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: You saved us! \n Thank you.

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: I also thought it was that guy! \n He had always been so weird.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: He told me to tell you guys to go search for the scientist. \n She's hiding behind the shadow.

Dialogue.name: Sophia
Dialogue.text: The chief finally spoke! \n I'll see you later!

Dialogue.name: Charlotte
Dialogue.text: Oh... you're the new member.

Dialogue.name: Charlotte
Dialogue.text: Damn it! \n I've been observing that damn paper in his hand for a while now, but why did I not notice it!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: You'll need to search for the scientist. \n He said that the scientist is behind the shadow.

Dialogue.name: Charlotte
Dialogue.text: Yeah, sure. \n I'll be looking forward to working with you again!

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: Hey there, mate! \n Nice move befriending that gloomy person.

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: ...Though, I never saw his face anywhere.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Your chief ask you guys to search for the scientist. \n She's behind the shadow somewhere.

Dialogue.name: Leo
Dialogue.text: Roger that! \n Party after this?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Ha ha... maybe another time.

Dialogue.name: Asher
Dialogue.text: Hey! You're the person they are talking about? \n Cool! Let's go grab something to eat.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Uh...before that. The chief told us to search for the scientist behind the shadow.

Dialogue.name: Asher
Dialogue.text: Bruh. I'll definitely treat you to the meal next time!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What is up with him...

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What are they going on about so loudly?

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: YEAH! EVERYONE! \n THE CHIEF HAS CAPTURED THE SCIENTIST. \n HE WANTS EVERYONE TO GATHER IN THE MASK BUILDING.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( They got to her already? Where did they found her? )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( I should get a move to the mask building. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: This place... it's gone dark. \n The holograms are gone.

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: YEAH! EVERYONE! \n THE CHIEF HAS CAPTURED THE SCIENTIST. \n HE WANTS EVERYONE TO GATHER IN THE MASK BUILDING.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( What! They got to her already? I need to help her. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( I need to get to the mask building! )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( So this is the way Emma wants me to go. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: So, this is the secret... computer room.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What is it doing?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: And how am I going to shut this down?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: There's no going back now. \n I'll have to do it my way, then.
( Smashes the computer screen. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Hm... it's still running. \n Maybe smashing the thing below will do. It won't explode in my face, right?
* Smash sounds *

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Smoke... the smoke is coming out.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: It surely won't work anymore. \n I should go back to Emma.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: It surely won't work anymore. \n I should go back to Emma.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I need to turn it off before I leave.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( What's happening in here? )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Is that... Emma?! \n She's not moving at all! )

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Everyone! \n It is finally the day we are waiting for!

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: We are leaving today!

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: Finally! \n We can go back to out normal lives.

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: We are getting our freedom!

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: Back to our family!

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Hello, Elias. \n You are here.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Isn't this a bit overdoing?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: She told me that right now she's the same as us.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text:
We are aware of that knowledge. 
 However, she deserves it. 
 A murderer is still a murderer. 
 Her crime cannot remain unpunished.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I'll tell you why.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: The first time I came here, everything was full of sadness, and cannot accept that.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: And for the masks. \n I want everyone to see smile faces, even if it's from the masks.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: We all have places to go back.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: But she won't tell us the way out! \n She doesn't want us to leave! \n And she is paying for that!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: She doesn't know.

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: That's not true! \n She has to know the exit!

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: You have been protecting her since you came in here. \n Are you hiding anything from us?

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: He must know the exit! \n Capture him!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Wait! \n I also don't know the exit!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( What's happening in here? )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Is that... Emma?! \n She's not moving at all! )

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I have received information from her! \n Just the exit left to find!

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I greatly appreciate your help in this.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: As we discussed earlier, I got more information from her, and I want everyone to know.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( I am finally going out. )

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I believe there is an exit within the information!

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Hello, newcomer, could you help me talk with that gloomy guy over there? \n I think he might have some problems for a long time. \n Oh, and you must talk to him with caution, he seems to be a very sensitive person.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Thank you... Oh, and one more thing, this scrap of paper might be his. \n Please, return it when you talk to him.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Who are you? You shouldn't talk to me... you should know that I don't need to socialize here.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: You again? \n What do you want?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I just want to return this paper to you.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Hands over the Med prescription. )

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Oh, you can keep it or just throw it away. \n That scrap of paper isn't necessary anymore.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What do people around here usually eat? \n I see a pile of flesh meat on the altar.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: I don't know anything about the meat and I'm not interested in knowing, I am vegetarian.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: If you know me better, you might not want to... *Sneezes*!!

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: *Mumbles* \n (Um... looks like it's time to take the medicine.)

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: *Mumbles* \n (Uh... where is it? Come on, I am beginning to get sleepy.)

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: I just know that the medicine isn't as light as this one.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( So, I will take this med instead. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Gulp )

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: You want to give me this med? \n I might be appreciated that, but would you also take the med so I know that you didn't poisoned me or anything.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Okay, I will accept your offer... You might be a good guy. \n Can we meet each other on the 2nd floor? \n I will unlock the door for you.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Yeah, sure.
A weird altar with a strange idol and disgusting offerings.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Why should these masks take the medicine anyway?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I will take these meds then, they might work with something.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: And also some meat.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: The last med is stuck in the mask, I can't get it out.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: You have already talked to him? It seems to be going well, you spent some times on that floor but still able to get here.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Hm? \n Wait, what's that stain on your hands?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Oh, I think I got this when I tried to help that guy with something.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: To be honest, it smells really nasty. Please, take this.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Oh, thank you.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: You're welcome, it's our job to take a good care of the key holder.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Wait, what? )

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: You talked with that guy?

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: You shouldn't talk to him, he is the most dangerous person here.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: You didn't tell him about my med right?

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Alright, you must avoid socializing with anyone around here, they are not like us.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Okay? \n So, why did you ask me to come here?

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Oh, right! \n Can you help me find some water? \n I can't take the medicine like this.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Fine. \n ( What's wrong with this guy, can't find some water by himself? )

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Have you found any water?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Not yet.

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Please hurry. \n I don't want to hold this med while that guy is still in this room.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Why don't you find it yourself? )

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Um... Excuse me? You want me to take the med with liqueur?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Why not?

Dialogue.name: Bob
Dialogue.text: Why yes?! \n Please be serious, I'm in hurry!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( What an annoying human. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Have you look at this sheet?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: No, I don't want to interfere with personal information.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Oh, maybe this might be an exception.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: You know what? you really did a great job. \n let's meet on the 3rd floor.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Try not to go back for now. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( Another locked door. )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( It's a human-size wooden puppet with the real human size. )

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Oh, you're here. First thing first, I have something to tell you.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: First, we found the traitor from the evidence that you gave to me. \n Although, all of us have med prescription, but no one is required to take the bedtime medicine.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Second, I'm not sure if you know, but you are now a key holder.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: And that means you are necessary for our ceremony.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: So... What do I have to do?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Here is our order 'The traitor does not deserve judgements from the others, but the key holder will be the one who gives him a warm welcome.'

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: That's my job? \n Let me figure something out.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: In case you forgot the order.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: 'The traitor does not deserve judgements from the others, but the key holder will be the one who gives him a warm welcome.'

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Looks like there is no way to open it.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Did it just scream?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: You've done a great job. \n Come meet us on the 1st floor after this.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: ( He is really fast. I better be hurry. )

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Welcome, our new member. \n With us, I can guarantee that you will be happy. \n ETERNAL HAPPINESS!

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Congratulations. \n You passed the test, just as I thought.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: You are now one of us. \n Please, take this mask.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Ah... no thanks. \n More importantly! You were going to tell me about the exit weren't you?

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I'm surely I have told you that, however...

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: You must have heard news about... the scientist that just came up from other people, yes?

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: That scientist's name is Emma!

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Hm... You seem to have known her.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Emma... \n She helped me passed the mansion test.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Very skeptical indeed. \n She must have planned something. We must not let her stay here for long.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: You have the phone, right? Take note of this, surely this is the place where that scientist is.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Elias, as a new member of our group, I have a task for you.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: I need you to deliver this message to everyone.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Tell them, 'The scientist is hiding in the shadow'.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: We are going to find her, and we are going to find the answer together.

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: After that, we will be leaving this place. \n She will be our key out of here.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( The hiding place behind the shadow? )

Dialogue.name: Noel
Dialogue.text: Good luck. \n We'll be able to leave this place soon.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Why... am I... here?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ? There's a new message from the tablet.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: It's...lock. \n What?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: How? \n I cannot hear anything outside.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Wait, I think this puppet must be burnt already.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: And what about this knife?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What?! \n This thing can talk?

Dialogue.name: puppet
Dialogue.text: Who are you? \n Your voice is not like those monsters.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Yeah, need some help to get out of this puppet?

Dialogue.name: puppet
Dialogue.text: If you could, I will be really grateful.

Dialogue.name: puppet
Dialogue.text: But the point is I don't even know how I can get into this puppet.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Um.... Let me figure something out.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Hm, a padlock with three keyholes?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: These symbols might relate to something I have to find.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: There is something obscured in this torch.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: It's a key.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Hello, are you a newcomer?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Don't you remember me? \n I just passed your test a couple of hours ago.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: I don't think so....

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: However, take this paper. \n Whoever come in this place have to hold it.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Oh, and there are some rules you'll have to learn.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What rules?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: It's what every members have to do to join our cult. \n Let's start when you are ready.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Let's see how each member has pass this test.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: What should you do to befriend with the unknown?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: What should you do when you don't know how to help a friend in trouble?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: What should you do when a guy ask you to do something unreasonable?

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Wow, you are also one of us right? \n I'll give you this key as a memento.

Dialogue.name: Arlo
Dialogue.text: Make yourself at home.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Where did those mask go?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Ah.. these offerings are disgusting as always.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: There's another one?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: There's another one?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: So... this thing is inside the meat.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Finally... wait, this didn't make the puppet open.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: There is something behind the padlock.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I don't think this is a good idea. \n I might kill him by accident.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I'm curious about what's behind this door.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Farewell, puppet boy.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Is this...behind the hologram?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Emma! Is that you?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: ? Are you... Elias?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What are you talking about? \n Yes, I'm Elias! Don't you remember?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Guess what? You're right. \n I kind of forget that.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What! \n Are you serious? When you told me that you have a bad memory I didn't think it is this bad

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I have my own ways. \n Look, I have noted everything important on my arms.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: That might help a bit... wait! \n Aren't you the one behind this experiment?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: About that... I have anwers. \n I've read about this, please, let me explain.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( After all of this, I bet she knew everything from the start )

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: But before that, there is something else.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What! \n You can't just-

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Look at my arm! \n There's a writing said 'The goal is to get outside'.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: True, but...

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Come on, it seems I don't have much time left. \n Some documents are also missing...

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What do you mean?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Well, you see, I'm sort of being hunt by those people, and this place is not safe.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: And you probably know the exit.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Of course! \n Listen carefully.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Did you see shabby building near the mansion? \n There's a secret path to a secret room under the carpet.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Once you got in, turn off that machine inside the room and come back here.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Aren't you coming?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Going out right now might not be the best idea for me. \n Ha ha...

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( She looks tired. People on this floor are uncomfortably weird. \n I should help her. )

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Well... it seems there was a time where I was a scientist. \n But right now, I doubt I'm one.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Does that means you know the way out?

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I...There was a situation and I got banned from project before the last part of the experiment is designed.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: And as you can see, from the start, I am the same as you -- a lab rat.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I have someone I want to meet when we got out.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: I think... you will be subjected to more experiment projects.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Then they might create an army of Eliases. \n Something like that.

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: Your family will receive the some kind of compensations. \n But you will stuck here.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( I will be stuck here forever? \n This is worse than I thought. Even if this is a military service it's still terrible. )

Dialogue.name: Emma
Dialogue.text: H... hey! \n We will get out of here.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Ugh...it felt like I was being pushed up here.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: This place...feels like...in a war.

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: To the left, for the left.

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: Our hope... Our hope has come.

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Congratulations, you have passed the test.

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: There is a person waiting for you.
What are you waiting for? \n Come on in, nothing to worry about.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I should do what the butler told me.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Is this...war?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: We have been constrained beneath the war all along?

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: To the right way, to the right!

Dialogue.name: People
Dialogue.text: You have to go to the right way!

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Greetings Mr Elias. \n You have walked down the wrong path. \n Hence...

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: I won't be able to let you pass.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What does that mean?

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: Ms. Emily has decided that you lack of humaneness.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: What does that even mean?!

Dialogue.name: Butler
Dialogue.text: My apologies.
What a shame. \n The subject named Elias is still imperfect.
... This is such an unfortunate event. \n They both were so close.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: This is the way to the military cantonment!

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: That must be my destination.
Finally, we got a usable seed.
At last... we have accomplished something.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Are those thing inside the tube... Corpses?! \n Is this the lab?
Took you long enough.
Everyone always think that.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: My name is Emily, a scientist supervising this place. \n And... a daughter of Emma that you've met.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Daughter? \n But... you look... your age... shouldn't be...?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: It's 2046, though you might think it is 2020.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Are you saying that me and your mother... travelled into the future... something like that?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: No no no. You guys are the samples from the seed, and are being selected under this project.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Seed...? \n Can you, uh...give me the brief of the...current situation?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: This is a project called 'Underground', a huge project beneath the Earth surface where we create armies of qualitie clones to use in the upcoming war.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: War? \n What about everything I've seen below? Even my room.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: Surely, everything has been created by us, even your room. Everything is from your memory.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: So, the people down there won't be able to meet their goals from the beginning?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: As you said. \n Mother thought they will eventually recover from the distorted behavior.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: Even so, all they really did was making their own colony and talking nonsense. \n They weren't even trying to find the way out.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: Even so, it's the same reason why I still left her down there. \n In spite of her memory issues, it is almost impossible for her to come out.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: I'm still amazed how you managed to help her out.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: But let's just throw away the past. \n I want you to choose what will happen next.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Me... choosing?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: It's what she wanted.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: She wanted you to live a happy life in the outside world.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Is it really okay to let me go?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: It's fine. There are lots of people down there. \n Sooner or later, someone will be able to replace you. \n I can't imagine a chicken like you to be in an army anyways.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: But that's your choice to choose. \n If you choose to be with the army, you might be helping out a lot of people.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: ( My choice... )

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: If you want to return to a normal life, then good luck. Continue this way, I'll handle everything else.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: But if you want to join the army, walk back out through the lab door. \n My Butler robot will handle everything.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I've rest enough all these 26 years. \n Maybe there's still someone out there that I know.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: There is definitely someone you know. \n I believe so.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: So, can you tell me something about myself? \n What happened throughout these years that I'm gone.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: Are you sure? How about what you are going to do after this?

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I don't know. \n Maybe I'll go find what Emma left behind. \n I feel like I used to know her.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: I'd like to thank Emma, but, I don't know, going out at these times sounds scary.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: As expected of you.

Dialogue.name: Elias
Dialogue.text: Hm? \n What does that mean?

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: Everything has come to an end, mom.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: He somehow turned into one of the good soldiers at the last minute.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: It's a pity we have to erase all of his memories.

Dialogue.name: Emily
Dialogue.text: We can only hope he'll become our great success.
